heaviest_rainfall.status: Record-breaking rain fell on 04 January 2025 with a total accumulation of 36.8mm over 37.2 hours and falling at a rate of 4.6mm per hour at times.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The rain rate reached 22.1mm per hour during the storm today (ranking 2nd from our records) and resulted in 8.61mm of total rain in 5.1 hours.  27.0mm per hour is the maximum rain rate ever recorded on 02 September 2025, during a 15.0 hour storm which dumped 21.19mm of rain from the clouds.

longest_rain.status: Rain fell for 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025 creating a new record that still lasts.  The storm produced a total of 36.8mm with a maximum intensity of 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: The most lightning activity recorded in a single day is 23, which occurred on 07 September 2025 (since our records began on 11 April 2025).

nearest_lightning.status: The closest lightning strike since monitoring began on 11 April 2025 was recorded today.

storm.status: There is a storm around.  It's the first significant stormy weather event since 12 September 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The ongoing rainy stretch, 5 days and counting started on 09 September 2025 and ranks 11th in length since records started in 23 September 2024.  The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: At the moment, it is not a cold snap.  This year has seen 6 cold snaps; typically, 3.7 cold snaps happen every year.

extreme.status: The record temperature difference stands at 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C), set on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: At the moment, it is not a heatwaves.  This year has seen 6 heatwavess; typically, 1.9 heatwavess happen every year.

tropical.status: The most recent tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and this has only occurred 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (196°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: To date, the maximum wind gust recorded is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: 1754 miles is the largest wind run recorded on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The highest wind speed ever seen is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, more moisture-laden rainfall (up 0.9 mm).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 659 m), feels like temperature (up 4.5°C), outside temperature (up 3.2°C), and inside temperature (up 2.6°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 178.6m lower than yesterday, 203.9m lower than the past week, 658.8m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels for yesterday ranged from 939m to 3180m and averaged 1607.7m, while the past week and month indicated warmer conditions.
cloud levels.summary: The sky’s high clouds will permit plenty of sunshine.

summary.summary: Inside; temperatures should be quite comfortable. Outside; moderate and mild. Also, pleasant humidity levels and winds will be practically absent. Rain showers likely, the sky’s high clouds will permit plenty of sunshine, and a mix of sun and clouds. Changeable conditions.
